item.title: Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Architect

Job Description

RBC is a digitally-enabled relationship bank. We strive to engage our customers when, how and where it’s most convenient and to provide a highly-personalized experience. We also collaborate broadly with innovative business and technology partners to create a platform and ecosystem that can bring even more value to our customers. We care deeply about the success of our customers and communities.

We’re looking for an experienced solution architect who is passionate about our mission to join the RBC Digital team. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team with customer focus and will strive for the best end-user experience in addition to having the drive and desire to keep learning the latest architecture developments, standards and techniques.

The primary focus of this position is to provide technology and architectural leadership with respect to the design and delivery of highly-scalable customer data and insights solutions leveraging machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) platforms.

This work will support development and delivery of information-intensive initiatives based on common practices for multiple complex projects.


What will you do?

  • Collaborate with business leaders to determine how to best apply technology to enable growth and success (e.g. scalable domain-driven solutions, operational reporting, SRE practices)
  • Provide architectural strategic thinking, information solutions, and input into roadmaps to drive delivery
  • Ensure architectural compliance of solutions and introduce recommendations for changes to reference model(s) when needed.
  • Maintain a plan to address gaps between current and target state architectures
  • Participate in \'reuse, buy and build\' decisions.
  • Understand potential impacts of proposed solutions on other systems, processes and/or projects
  • Articulate and document designs, considering trade-offs, costs, and benefits
  • Develop ongoing knowledge of current and emerging technologies
  • Identify new and emerging solutions, assess relevance and potential value to the organization, and present findings to teammates and management.
  • Participate in day-to-day execution of the architecture strategy
  • Develop blueprints and conduct design reviews to ensure architectural compliance of solutions.
  • Work across multiple projects and systems to develop, communicate, and mentor others on solution design, implementation and operation patterns and best practices

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Background in data architecture, analytics, and cloud native solutions
  • Experience with analysis techniques and measurement tools to continuously build valuable insights and business recommendations.
  • Strategic mindset with strong change management, continuous improvement and transformation skills
  • Strong technical skills in application development (data pipelines, services, streaming platforms)
  • Knowledge of identity and data access management and security best practices
  • Working knowledge in data acquisition, data storage & computational patterns with industry standard tools
  • Experience supporting mission-critical applications in production
  • Software engineering skills with distributed computing background and proven experience in delivering large-scale data platforms.
  • Good understanding of data fabric/mesh concepts and semantic layers

Nice to have:

  • Business or product leadership experience
  • Hands-on working experience with cloud native solution such as SnowFlake, DataBricks, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue/Lamba, RedShift, Azure DW.
  • Experience with next generation solution delivery on technologies such as Python, Kafka, Spark, Apigee, Jenkins; container solutions including Docker/Kubernetes; and private cloud platforms such as Openshift (OCP) or Pivotal (PCF)
  • Exposure to building and deploying predictive and prescriptive analytics models using any of the following: Python SciKit, R and Pytorch.
  • Experience with Salesforce (CRM), Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) and/or Palintir Foundry

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Member of the front-end chapter, which provides training, events, and other opportunities for learning. You will also have an opportunity to share your work and experience with your peers

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options​

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Analytics Lead
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Lead

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission.

What is the opportunity?

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture/Enterprise Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members.

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.
  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must have

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Data Science, Consulting).
  • Fluent in SQL (for analyses & creating reports) and predictive analytics in R or Python. 
  • Experience communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.
  • An eager listener and a team player who is comfortable forming cross functional relationships with our partners.
  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in improving business processes using ML is a big plus.
  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a plus.
  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

RBC Ventures

item.title: Manager, Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is hiring an exciting Manager, CRM Analytics role. In this role, you will work closely with members of the CRM Analytics team and collaborate with various partners including the Lines of Business across Personal and Commercial Banking providing actionable insights and developing solutions that enhance the client experience and drive value for the business.

What will you do?

  • Examine and evaluate all facets of the marketing leads conversion process in order to produce key findings and recommendations that augment offer fulfillments
  • Analyze utilization of Outbound resources to optimize marketing opportunities for individual campaigns
  • Analyze Call Centre and Branch Inbound client interaction sessions to enhance actioning and fulfilling of product and service offers
  • Conduct marketing contact channel analyses to provide pertinent information and proposals supporting Client Interaction Strategy to enhance client experience and drive business values
  • Develop dashboards and monitor performance of various marketing channels to ensure client interactions are uniquely managed in the constantly evolving environment
  • Deliver insightful and actionable analytics to underpin the Client Growth initiative enabling client acquisition and retention across all lines of business
  • End-to-end responsibility for campaign analyses including framing of analytical objectives with partners, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analyses and presenting key insights to stakeholders in timely and effective manner
  • Provide analytical support in other associated client and marketing initiatives

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Proficient technical knowledge with very large relational databases and with tools such as SAS and SQL
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong problem solving skill and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management
  • Experience with Hadoop and Google Analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • An opportunity to influence the strategic direction of the enterprise
  • An opportunity to work closely with RBC’s senior leaders
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and high performing culture
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Director, AML Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, AML Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Director, AML Analytics, you are responsible for providing an analytics strategy in the design and implementation of the AML Investigator of the Future platform.  This is transformational role that arises from two emerging trends in anti-financial crime programs: the propagation of data / analytics capabilities used to detect financial crime and the need to identify increasingly complex-organized money laundering operations.  You work with AML Insight and Analytics, the AML Transformation Office and the AML Financial Intelligence Unit to build and deliver leading edge analytic detection and investigative capabilities.  In addition, you leverage your past investigative experience and knowledge of graph analytics to provide technical expertise and insights into complex investigations. 

What will you do?

  • Apply sophisticated modelling techniques, including graph and machine learning analytics, to develop and implement components of the AML Investigator of the Future platform

  • Establish a development roadmap for network risk scoring (batch and dynamic) by defining the prevalent features that will be integrated into the monitoring program and used in the course of an investigation

  • Explore application machine learning techniques and network analysis around threat/risk typologies, client segmentation, entity resolution, and alert risk scoring for effective deployment of analytics to the AML program

  • Enable the next generation of analytics tools for investigations

  • Provides analytic support for complex investigations by providing detection strategies, investigative insights, network analysis and macro level analysis

  • Proactive Data Investigative Analytics –Actively pursue  opportunities to provide relevant and valuable intelligence to the Financial Investigation Unit and Major Financial Crimes

  • Identify opportunities to streamline or automate processes to promote efficient and effective use of resources

  • Explore data availability and usage across Financial Crimes to spot opportunities for system or process enhancement

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience with AML or fraud modeling and investigation environments that utilize detection / predictive models

  • Programming experience ideally using an object oriented programing language such as Java, Scala (ideally), R or Python.

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience leading a data science or analytics team

  • Agile development methodology

  • Statistical approaches and methods and their application on projects

  • Post-secondary education or equivalent.

Nice-to-have

  • Graduate degree (MBA or relevant subject matter area)

  • Data mapping, meaning of relational data and object orientation.

  • Understands projects needs and can translate into detection models and capabilities.

  • Model documentation, ideally AML model governance

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will have the opportunity to apply analytics to the point of client interaction with the Digital Products of RBC.  You will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle: data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations. 

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure and complete analyses, uncover insights, develop net new data assets, and build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 5+ years of experience in related digital product development, data analyst or data mining role
  • Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm for advancing digital analytics and products
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala and PowerPoint
  • Experience with Jupyter Notebooks, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau or comparable data visualization tools
  • Hands-on knowledge of agile methodologies Github and JIRA
  • Structured thinking: developing an end-to-end analysis plans to tackle ambiguous and open-ended business problems
  • Stakeholder management skills: ability to inform and influence stakeholders through data, build relationships, communicate early and often
  • High agency: figuring out a way to get the job done, pushing through in the face of imperfect conditions or managing to reverse adverse conditions to achieve goals

Nice-to-have

  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Design, oversee and deliver analytics on client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use data mining and a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights
    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support product development strategies and drive decisions
    • Help implement re-usable analytics frameworks for use across Digital data
  • Data Collection/ Ingestions/ Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
  • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
  • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities
  • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Actively support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Manage stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with progress on deliverables
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Regional Banking Support’s BFS Reporting is hiring a Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management role that will support strategic reporting and visual insights for Regional Banking’s BFS by successfully transforming data into useful, relevant information, and by leveraging sound business knowledge, additional sources of information, and resources to deliver insight to the BFS field.  The position plays a role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders in a BFS banking environment, alongside key technology partners. 

What will you do?

  • Utilize cutting edge business intelligence capabilities to optimize business results, define, measure, and deliver insights and mitigate risk.

  • Design and develop/enhance innovative reporting solutions to monitor performance management, present key analytical and business insights to underlying drivers in support of the BFS advisors and leaders on client and coaching insights to drive an exceptional client experience.

  • Take end to end responsibility in the development and enhancement of performance metrics and reporting in Tableau.

  • Respond to ad-hoc investigations, inquiries, data, and report requests as assigned.

  • Run production jobs as assigned.

  • Demonstrate Subject Matter Expertise in data and reporting infrastructure design, configuration and optimization, providing recommendations on approach and execution.

  • Apply standard design principles and data visualization techniques to measure key indicators, disclose trends, provide proactive actionable insights/indicators and address business questions.

  • Identify appropriate data sources and perform Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) for data modelling, data quality assessments, understand patterns and provide the basis to inform the reporting solution which provides meaningful performance management insights.

  • Participate in conversations with internal partners to understand their business strategies (role design, incentive, practice management and portfolio quality) and objectives in order to define/recommend reporting solutions to meet those objectives, effectively communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction.

  • Participate in design and solution review demonstrations with the Senior Manager and/or internal partners at critical tollgates to ensure adherence to requirements, resolve obstacles, while mitigating deployment risk and the need for post-deployment modifications.

  • Test and validate (QA) new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements.

  • Enhance and optimize existing production processes.  

  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases.

  • Be a thought partner within the BFS Reporting team, supporting the developments of insights, processes, data approaches/ methodologies and information that is valued by partners across Regional Banking and BFS.

  • Learn on a consistent basis, be adaptable to change due to re-prioritizing of items.

       

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, related field or equivalent related experience.

  • Demonstrated ETL and big data modeling capabilities, with programming experience in large databases/datasets and using SAS, SQL Server and Teradata SQL Assistant.

  • Experience in statistical methods, strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining.

  • Proficient in SQL extracts in order to investigate data from data warehouse and other sources (flat files) for investigation/analysis purposes.

  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leaders in order to inform of strategic decisions.

  • Proven quantitative analytical (including data knowledge, data discovery, data aggregation and summarization) and problem solving skills.

  • UNIX knowledge (i.e. submit process, create logs, store data).

  • Advanced in developing reports using Tableau.

  • Data knowledge on RBC’s EDW.

  • Be skilled in Microsoft applications (Excel, PowerPoint).

  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience.

Nice-to-have

  • Financial Services Industry/Business Financial Services knowledge

  • Experience in developing performance metrics/reports

  • Programming/coding skills in Python and Hadoop (HIVE) and Datameer

  • Experience with Tableau Security, Tableau Server Administration

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.description:

Job Title

Project Manager - Talent Data & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will lead and manage several key transformational projects for the Talent Data & Analytics team. These projects all contribute to the digital transformation of HR as part of the Reimagine HR program. Projects can include setting up data management and sustainment teams, driving infrastructure upgrades, managing RFPs/RFIs, supervising new product builds etc. Your experience as a project manager/scrum master driving data and analytics projects has prepared you for the challenge of standing up new teams and processes, dealing with several stakeholders across the bank and responding dynamically to changing requirements.

What will you do? 

  • Effectively manage the planning, organization and implementation of all major transformational projects in Talent Data & Analytics.
  • Develop and manage detailed development sprints, identify early warning indicators, provide direction for early resolution of risks, issues and clear escalation path for program committees.

  • Collaborate with internal and external partners (e.g. Vendors, RBC IT teams, Product)
  • Build and present updates to project sponsors and executive steering committees
  • Oversee the development of program/project plans, KPIs and metrics (including status reporting), prioritization calls & project communications.
  • Ensure the completion of risk assessments and the identification & execution of contingency plans.
  • Deliver initiatives using appropriate methods, including Agile and Iterative Waterfall.
  • Satisfy multiple stakeholders in a complex business and technology environment

What do you need to succeed?

  • A proven track record of successfully delivering complex projects with a wide range of stakeholders and skillsets
  • Verbal and written communication skills with excellent attention to detail, and passion for innovation

  • Advanced knowledge of change, issue, and risk management and working knowledge of Software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile delivery methodologies/day-2-day ceremonies; Agile experience fostering team improvements through standard Agile processes and ceremonies.

Nice-to-have

item.title: Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission

What is the opportunity?

Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.

About Ownr

At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We\'re on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 

What you will do

  • Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights
  • Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.
  • Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.
  • Create, manage, and maintain KPI\'s to monitor, analyze and improve conversion
  • Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities
  • Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.
  • Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.
  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.
  • Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.
  • Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.
  • Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.

 

Skills you\'ll need to succeed

 Must have

  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).
  • Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.
  • Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.
  • In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.
  • Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value
  • Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.
  • Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.
  • A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.
  • Ability to speak to business functions, customers and partners with confidence and professionalism.
  • Commitment to winning as a team.
  • An entrepreneurial & innovative spirit

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with the development process, use of tools like GitHub
  • Experience using analytics tools such as: SQL, Amplitude, and Metabase

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

 Launching and running a business can be daunting. But, at Ownr, we bring entrepreneurs closer to their dreams.

 

We have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. Our industry-leading tools, resources, and ongoing support make it as easy as possible for entrepreneurs to start and succeed.

 

VSPRODUCT

RBC Ventures

item.title: Lead Python Developer - Data Protection and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Python Developer - Data Protection and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. This opportunity is suitable for someone who is skilled in web application development, motivated, someone who enjoy working on a variety of problems and enhancements, someone who works well in a multi-disciplinary team as well as working independently on key tasks.

If you want to innovate and be part of a big picture strategic delivery with a direct impact on organization change this is the placement for you!

What will you do?

  • Delivering new design and development specifications based on customer requirements, while adhering to standard procedures and techniques.
  • Creating test transactions and running tests to find errors and revise application programs.
  • Participating in post-implementation reviews of application development content and processes; continually working to create a learning environment by sharing about the participation process with others.
  • Supporting the implementation of application programs; fixing any existing or new bugs.
  • Design, Develop and enhance current web services
  • Help design, implementing and optimized UI functions
  • Collaborate within the team and stakeholders to enhance and expand current solutions

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience
  • 3-5 years of professional full stack development
  • 3+ years with experience of working with Python/Java/HTML/CSS/SQL
  • Ability to understand software requirements based on program specification
  • Demonstrated experience with building web application frameworks like flask
  • Strong knowledge of web design, testing phases and working with data science
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle and experience with API
  • Experience of development in Cloud environment
  • Excellent analytical skills and problem solving attitude
  • Experience with relational databases(MSSQL, MySQL)

Nice to have

  • Experience with machine learning and statistical techniques, testing/validation, visualizing data, test results and assess model performance
  • Experience with analytics, anomaly detection, model refinement and efficacy
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop, NoSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques, and graph technologies
  • Experience in building backend system with Python, Flask
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of DevOps and strong debugging skills
  • Experience with Git and process automation
  • Experience in UI/UX Design

What’s in it for you?
 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Opportunity to develop industry-leading solutions that target cyber security concerns within a mature organization
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.description:

What is the opportunity?

Opportunity to drive the vision and lead two growing and successful Data Service products: Galileo and PATH. 

Galileo is a self-serve, one-stop "Storefront" to empower the organization with access to data, tools and processes without the dependency on heavy IT support/involvement.  PATH is a journey analytics platform that connects data points across systems and channels to uncover opportunities to improve client experience and operational efficiency.

What will you do?

  • “Product evangelist” to the product team, business partners and executives. You are accountable for creating and telling the product story so that it is understood by a variety of audiences and generates demand/ adoption.

  • Create documentation / collateral for effective communication with partners and executives. Provide updates and supporting materials for key meetings and presentations on progress.

  • Establish and deliver ongoing metrics related to adoption, usage and enabled value.

  • Work closely with our business development team, business partners, product owners (delivery leads) to identify opportunities, prioritize feature development, and provide  transparency of roadmaps

  • Collaborate with Architecture and product teams to ensure product architecture/ design principles/ standards are in place to improve performance, capacity, resiliency and scalability of your product(s).

  • Collaborate with user experience and design specialists

  • Collaborate with Architecture/ product teams/ user experience and design specialists to ensure product architecture/ design principles/ standards are in place to improve performance, capacity, resiliency and scalability of your product(s) while ensuring easy access and ease of use.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 10+ years proven track record of leading/ launching software products or programs.

item.title: Director Credit Modeling and Methodology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director Credit Modeling and Methodology

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology will lead the development of RBC’s Wholesale AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data infrastructure perspective.

You will focus on leading a team building out the infrastructure for data ingested for modeling Wholesale parameters: PD, LGD and EAD monitoring and development. You will assist the Senior Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring.  You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters.

We are looking for a strong high-performing leader to become a key partner on the data side of quantitative model development. We are a team that prides itself for high quality work with significant impact across the bank and continuous interaction with other groups, senior management and regulators. Given the nature of our work, the opportunity to learn, grow and expand your network is significant. 

What will you do?

  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon Wholesale processes and credit risk data used at RBC

  • Lead a team of qualified subject matter experts in all manner of data analytics

  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization

  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data & analytical methodology 

  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to

  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies

  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders

 What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong leadership capabilities to provide mentorship to a team of data analytics professionals

  • Wholesale credit risk modeling knowledge and lending products data acumen

  • Strong data manipulation capability with advanced SQL programming skills; experience in SAS, Python or similar tools

  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights

  • At least 5 years working experience with lending products and related databases

  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with relational databases and data visualization tools

 Nice-to-have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) – to demonstrate capability for critical thinking and data analysis

  • Experience in the Financial industry

  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment

  • Expertise in navigating an Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with Hadoop environments, Python, R or other tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program

  • Leaders who support your development through training and coaching

  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative team with ability to make a difference

Job Summary

Lead the team responsible for data infrastructure used in Wholesale Parameter Estimation, a process that generates ~$200bn RWA. Accountable for the analysis and oversight of the data behind Wholesale parameters.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Scientist

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

In this role as a Senior Data Scientist you will analyze, design and implement data science / machine learning solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools.  The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics.  Leveraging leading-edge technologies and capabilities, the group applies machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.       

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with key business partners and stakeholders to understand business objectives/opportunities and problem statements in order to provide solutions that align to business needs that are actionable with a tangible outcome

  • Prepare and transform data (structured/non-structured)

  • Develop and deploy ML solutions at scale

  • Prepare, integrate large and varied datasets and implement statistical and ML models using Python and R.

  • Leverage visualization tools/packages to story-tell and to convey data-driven insights with actionable recommendations to key stakeholders

  • Quickly learn new methods, tools and technologies presented in research communities to implement, adapt and innovate

  • Effectively communicate findings to business partners and executives.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Sociology or Psychology.

  • 3-5 years of experience in data solutions and applying data techniques.

  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data science technologies.

  • 3+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive analytics, and statistical modeling. Familiar with programing and scripting languages Python, R, Java and SQL.

  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, time management and organizational skills.

Nice to have:

  • Familiar with a range of data tools.

  • Experience in programming, scripting languages and data visualization.

  • Familiar with a Linux environment and shell scripting.

  • Familiar with data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types.

What’s in it for you?

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Reporting to the Associate Director, Shared Data Management Operations (SDMO) this role is a key contributor in ensuring the integrity, accuracy and completeness of Finance and Risk data across various finance and risk domains. The incumbent will support and perform the key risk reconciliations and present the results of these reconciliations to various stakeholders. The incumbent will develop and maintain working relationships across the organization including Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, Finance, Internal/External Audit, SOX Office, Wealth Management and other enterprise functions.

All responsibilities carried out in accordance with Code of Conduct, RBC Values and Guiding Principles ensuring adherence to Privacy principles.

What will you do? 

  • Complete and prepare key reconciliations between Finance and Risk data systems across the various data domains within the bank ensuring the integrity, accuracy and completeness of Finance and Risk data.
  • Develop and maintain reconciliations to provide assurance to Credit Risk, Market Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk, Finance, Capital Measurement and Regulatory Reporting teams regarding the accuracy & completeness of the data in RBC’s reporting and data management  systems.
  • Provide assurance that the specific and aggregate data values reconcile with authoritative sources and/or systems of record.
  • Evaluate any unmitigated risks and control weaknesses, and recommend new or modified reconciliation controls, consistent with the stakeholder’s requirements.
  • Maintain and update key processes and documentation for SOX & Audit compliance.
  • Act as a business subject matter expert and conducting information gathering sessions to assess, analyze and document reconciliation needs
  • Manage detailed business requirements: identifying, tracking and resolving business systems issues.
  • Recommend business solutions that satisfy sponsor/stakeholder needs while continually exploring and assessing options to centralize, standardize and streamline reconciliation and business processes.
  • Undertake new projects and change initiatives including and analysis and requirements gathering, defining target results and designing and documenting effective, repeatable processes.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • 5+ years of experience in accounting, risk management, data management and/or business analysis.
  • Relevant experience with credit risk data, data quality principles, data control design, self-assessment of existing processes and systems.
  • Undergraduate degree in a numerical discipline, business administration, finance or a combination.
  • Good communications skills, verbal and written.
  • Some experience with business and/or technical documentation and the assessment of existing processes and systems.

Nice-to-have

  • Self-starter, highly motivated, having a strong drive to achieve tangible results.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities in times of stress.
  • Ability to analyze and comprehend complex financial products, reporting and data related issues.
  • Familiarity with financial service regulatory requirements and guidelines (e.g. BCBS239, IFRS 9, CECL)
  • Knowledge of SQL, Python, Hadoop, Tableau etc.
  • Professional Certification (CPA, CFA, FRM and/or other)

What’s in it for you?  
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

You will work in a collaborative work environment with highly skilled data management professionals, and leaders who support your development through coaching and new opportunities

  • Opportunity to contribute directly to current and ongoing data quality and completeness initiatives that will have a lasting impact
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Develop insights into the application and use of finance and risk data used in regulatory reporting risk and capital management and compliance
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.description:

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title

Sr. Data Analyst – Campaign Decisioning

Job Description

What will you do?

Our team is the Client Interaction Decision Management (CIDM) team. We are looking for a passionate, energetic and talented data enthusiast to join our team. This is a hybrid/technical role where we collaborate with Marketing, Product groups and Channel partners to help drive business results. In this role, you will be responsible for the implementation of data-driven client treatments including direct marketing, triggers as well as other client communications. You will be considered the Centre of Excellence (COE) for client decisioning and distribution via various channels.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with key business stakeholders within Personal & Commercial Banking and Insurance to design, build and deploy data-driven client treatments
  • Evolve and optimize campaign test & learn design and build to ensure alignment to business and marketing objectives
  • Automate evergreen campaigns
  • Responsible for quality assurance to ensure the campaign requirements accurately match the design and build
  • Ensure corporate reputation is maintained by adhering to all best practices, privacy & legal guidelines, data stewardship and governance policies

What you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics or related field
  • 2+ years of experience in a data analytical role: Analytical programming languages (e.g., SAS, SQL, Python, R)
  • Ability to combine business acumen with technical expertise in order to deliver targeted campaigns on behalf of our business stakeholders
  • Agile mindset with the ability to think creatively to solve complex problems
  • Self-motivated, strong communication skills, attention to detail

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience in the financial services industry, including understanding of marketing
  • Strong desire to learn new tools and try new concepts that evolve and optimize current processes
  • Experience with various data housing environments (e.g. Teradata, Unix, DataLake, cloud)
  • Experience in campaign design and delivery (test & learn design, statistical significance…etc) 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. You will be establishing and fostering strong, collaborative relationships with internal partners and continuously look for new opportunities to automate processes. You will be considered the COE for client decisioning and distribution via various channels.

item.title: Manager - Credit Risk, HEF Portfolio
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager - Credit Risk, HEF Portfolio

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The incumbent supports the Senior Manager of Consumer Portfolio Management and the Portfolio Management & Credit Strategy (PM&CS) team in managing portfolio health with a focus on Home Equity Financing (HEF) Products ($300 Billion portfolio). The incumbent identifies trends and develops insights and makes recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecast. This role gives the incumbent the opportunity to build on these strengths: cross-enterprise mindset, understanding of consumer behaviour and RBC risk appetite, and adaptability to the dynamic credit environment. This position specializes in insight-generation through in-depth portfolio.

What Will You Do?

  • Use data to generate insights and support HEF portfolio analytics across the entire credit value chain and identify trends that support recommendations on acquisition, performance and loss forecast.
  • Deliver timely and accurate analytics by: Understanding business and regulatory reporting need, and establishing analytical framework. Performing all manner of data mining activities, including data validation. Summarizing findings, and communicating to stakeholders
  • Develop and execute routines to measure and monitor effectiveness of policy and process changes to determine success and make adjustment recommendations where required
  • Ongoing portfolio monitoring and commentary and provide regular performance updates to stakeholders
  • Partner with teammates to design incisive and meaningful risk-monitoring measures used to maintain overall portfolio quality
  • Have shared responsibility for building, validating, and automating new metrics and reports.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in Engineering, Statistics or other quantitative field of study
  • Significant experience with:
    • Advanced SQL skills
    • Strong SAS/Python or equivalent programming experience
    • Expert in MS Excel and PowerPoint
    • Effective and conversant in business and technical environment
    • Proven analytical skills
    • Good understanding of consumer behaviour and credit risk
  • Collaborative and supportive attitude
  • Creative thinker
  • Strong Attention to detail

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Teradata, DB2, Oracle
  • Familiarity with Tableau, R languages
  • Working knowledge of consumer credit products
  • Experience in credit risk
